elements.title: United Nations Secretariat Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the United Nations Secretariat Building (pictured) was finished, its staff were described as "neither united nor very peaceful"?

elements.title: Red Line (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after a 1968 split in the Communist Party of Italy (Marxist–Leninist), the Black Line and Red Line groups would engage in reciprocal acts of violence and vandalism?

elements.title: Maya Pindyck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that creating visual art led Maya Pindyck to write poetry?

elements.title: Missa brevis in C (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Missa brevis in C by František Brixi, an 18th-century kapellmeister at Prague Cathedral, was not published until 2004?

elements.title: Adolphe Smith Headingley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British writer Adolphe Smith Headingley popularised the singing of the socialist anthem "The Red Flag" to the tune of "O Tannenbaum" against the wishes of its lyricist?

elements.title: Hold On Baby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the late Foo Fighters member Taylor Hawkins plays the drums on the closing track of King Princess's album Hold On Baby?

elements.title: Adrian Becher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the First World War, Adrian Becher received his second Military Cross for leading the defence of a position for five days, despite having been buried by a shell explosion on the first day?

elements.title: Currambine railway station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 11 years after it opened in 1993, Currambine railway station was rebuilt 60 metres (200 ft) to the east?
